concept.title: Example: Aggregating constraint and expansion modules using DTDs
concept.shortdesc: The DITA architect wants to add some extension modules to the document-type shell for topic. The document-type shell already integrates a number of constraint modules.

keywords.indexterm: expansion modulesexamplesaggregating constraint and expansion modules
examplesexpansion modulesaggregating constraint and expansion modules

conbody.p: The following table lists the constraints that are currently integrated into the document-type shell:

ul.li: Reduces the content model of section to a smaller subset

strow.stentry: Reduces the highlighting domain elements to b and i

conbody.p: The following table lists the expansion modules that the DITA architect wants to add to the document-type shell:

strow.stentry: Adds an optional sectionDesc element to section. The sectionDesc element can only appear directly after title.
Adds dlentryMode to the attributes of dlentry.

conbody.p: The constraint and expansion modules that target the section element must be combined into a single element-configuration module. An element can only be targeted by a single element-configuration module.
